title: Inset the LilyCard hover background to better reveal rounded container borders

requirements.text: Update the LilyCard hover styling so the light gray hover background appears slightly inset (smaller than the card/container) to better reveal the rounded borders of the feed container on pages that render lily lists (e.g., Home page and Pond page).

quotes: the on hover effect for lilies in pages like pond page, and the homepage, etc. the light gray background that shows up, can you make it so its slighly smaller than the container/card so it looks like its inset. that way we can see the rounded borders better.

acceptanceCriteria: Hovering a lily card shows a light gray background that is inset from the card edges by a small, consistent spacing, rather than flush to the edges.
The inset hover background has rounded corners that visually complement the feed containerâ€™s rounded corners.
No layout shift occurs when hovering (card size/spacing does not change).
The change is visible and consistent on HomePage and PondPage lily lists (and any other page that uses the same LilyCard component).
On touch devices, behavior remains unchanged (no stuck hover state).

requirements.text: Ensure the inset hover effect does not interfere with LilyCard interactions (links, like button, share button, bookmark button), including pointer events and click targets.

quotes: the on hover effect for lilies in pages like pond page, and the homepage, etc. the light gray background that shows up, can you make it so its slighly smaller than the container/card so it looks like its inset.

acceptanceCriteria: All existing LilyCard click targets (title link, pond link, username link, like/share/bookmark actions) work as before.
Hover styling does not block clicks or change focus/keyboard navigation behavior.
The hover styling still animates smoothly (keeps a subtle transition).

constraints: Do not modify files under frontend/src/components/ui (read-only).
Keep the change scoped to UI styling; do not alter backend logic or data models.
nonGoals: Redesigning the feed layout, adding new features, or changing sorting behavior.
